history.proof: intros A B f l. induction l. - simpl. reflexivity. - simpl. rewrite -> map_app. rewrite -> IHl. reflexivity.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A), map f (rev l) = rev (map f l)

Premises:
rev : forall A : Type, list A -> list A
map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> list A -> list B
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
map_rev : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A), map f (rev l) = rev (map f l)
concat_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list (list A)), map f (concat l) = concat (map (map f) l)
flat_map_concat_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> list B) (l : list A), flat_map f l = concat (map f l)
map_map : forall (A B C : Type) (f : A -> B) (g : B -> C) (l : list A), map g (map f l) = map (fun x : A => g (f x)) l
map_cons : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (x : A) (l : list A), map f (x :: l) = f x :: map f l
map_length : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A), length (map f l) = length l
NoDup_map_inv : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A), NoDup (map f l) -> NoDup l
List.map_app : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l l' : list A), map f (l ++ l') = map f l ++ map f l'
map_app : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l1 l2 : list A), map f (l1 ++ l2) = map f l1 ++ map f l2
fold_left_rev_right : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B -> B) (l : list A) (i : B), fold_right f i (rev l) = fold_left (fun (x : B) (y : A) => f y x) l i
in_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (x : A), In x l -> In (f x) (map f l)
map_nth : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (d : A) (n : nat), nth n (map f l) (f d) = f (nth n l d)
map_eq_nil : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A), map f l = nil -> l = nil
in_map_iff : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (y : B), In y (map f l) < -> (exists x : A, f x = y /\ In x l)
ext_in_map : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), map f l = map g l -> forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a
map_nth_error : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (n : nat) (l : list A) (d : A), nth_error l n = Some d -> nth_error (map f l) n = Some (f d)
map_ext_in : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), (forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a) -> map f l = map g l
map_in : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (b : B) (xs : list A), In b (map f xs) -> exists a : A, b = f a /\ In a xs
Tauto.map_simpl : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A), map f l = match l with | nil => nil | a :: l0 => f a :: map f l0 end
concat_filter_map : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list (list A)), concat (map (filter f) l) = filter f (concat l)
map_ext : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B), (forall a : A, f a = g a) -> forall l : list A, map f l = map g l
rev_involutive : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), rev (rev l) = l
filter_map : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l < -> map f l = map g l
fold_right_app : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B -> B) (l l' : list A) (i : B), fold_right f i (l ++ l') = fold_right f (fold_right f i l') l
count_occ_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (decA : forall x1 x2 : A, {x1 = x2} + {x1 <> x2}) (decB : forall y1 y2 : B, {y1 = y2} + {y1 <> y2}), (forall x1 x2 : A, f x1 = f x2 -> x1 = x2) -> forall (x : A) (l : list A), count_occ decA l x = count_occ decB (map f l) (f x)
skipn_rev : forall (A : Type) (x : nat) (l : list A), skipn x (rev l) = rev (firstn (length l - x) l)
firstn_rev : forall (A : Type) (x : nat) (l : list A), firstn x (rev l) = rev (skipn (length l - x) l)
filter_In : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (x : A) (l : list A), In x (filter f l) < -> In x l /\ f x = true
rev_list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P (rev l) -> P (rev (a :: l))) -> forall l : list A, P (rev l)
filter_app : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l l' : list A), filter f (l ++ l') = filter f l ++ filter f l'
ext_in_filter : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l -> forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a
rev_length : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), length (rev l) = length l
filter_ext : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool), (forall a : A, f a = g a) -> forall l : list A, filter f l = filter g l
partition_inv_nil : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A), partition f l = (nil, nil) < -> l = nil
in_prod_aux : forall (A B : Type) (x : A) (y : B) (l : list B), In y l -> In (x, y) (map (fun y0 : B => (x, y0)) l)
filter_ext_in : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), (forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a) -> filter f l = filter g l
filter_ext_in_iff : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l < -> (forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a)
firstn_skipn_rev : forall (A : Type) (x : nat) (l : list A), firstn x l = rev (skipn (length l - x) (rev l))
flat_map : forall A B : Type, (A -> list B) -> list A -> list B
rev_app_distr : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A), rev (x ++ y) = rev y ++ rev x

``` 
intros A B f l.
induction l.
- simpl. reflexivity.
- simpl. rewrite -> map_app. rewrite -> IHl. reflexivity. 
```
